   17: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   18: %% @author Maxim Fedorov <maximfca@gmail.com>
   19: %% Basic process tracing profiler tests.
   20: -module(tprof_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server callbacks
   24: -export([suite/0, all/0]).
   25: 
   26: %% Test cases exports
   27: -export([
   28:     call_count_ad_hoc/0, call_count_ad_hoc/1,
   29:     call_time_ad_hoc/0, call_time_ad_hoc/1,
   30:     call_memory_ad_hoc/0, call_memory_ad_hoc/1,
   31:     lists_seq_loop/1, call_memory_total/1,
   32:     sort/0, sort/1,
   33:     rootset/0, rootset/1,
   34:     set_on_spawn/0, set_on_spawn/1, seq/1,
   35:     live_trace/0, live_trace/1,
   36:     patterns/0, patterns/1, pattern_fun/1, pattern_fun/2, pattern_fun/3,
   37:     processes/0, processes/1,
   38:     server/0, server/1,
   39:     hierarchy/0, hierarchy/1,
   40:     code_reload/0, code_reload/1,
   41:     code_load/0, code_load/1
   42: ]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   45: 
   46: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   47: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   51: 
   52: all() ->
   53:     [call_count_ad_hoc, call_time_ad_hoc, call_memory_ad_hoc,
   54:      call_memory_total,
   55:      sort, rootset, set_on_spawn, live_trace, patterns,
   56:      processes, server, hierarchy, code_reload].
   57: 
   58: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   59: %% TEST CASES
   60: 
   61: call_count_ad_hoc() ->
   62:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_count measurement"}].
   63: 
   64: call_count_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   65:     ct:capture_start(),
   66:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16]),
   67:     ct:capture_stop(),
   68:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
   69:     %% expect one line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3    5   [  ...]",
   70:     true =
   71:         lists:any(
   72:             fun
   73:                 ("lists:seq_loop/3" ++ Rest) ->
   74:                     [_, "[", _] = string:lexemes(Rest, " "),
   75:                     true;
   76:                 (_) ->
   77:                     false
   78:             end,
   79:             Output
   80:         ),
   81:     %% spawn examples
   82:     SpawnFun =
   83:         fun () ->
   84:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
   85:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
   86:        end,
   87:     %% trace subset examples
   88:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_count}),
   89:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile1),
   90:     %% timer
   91:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
   92:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
   93:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count,
   94:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
   95:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile2).
   96: 
   97: call_time_ad_hoc() ->
   98:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_time measurement"}].
   99: 
  100: call_time_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  101:     ct:capture_start(),
  102:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_time}),
  103:     ct:capture_stop(),
  104:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  105:     %% expect one line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3    5   ...   ...  [...]",
  106:     true =
  107:         lists:any(
  108:             fun
  109:                 ("lists:seq_loop/3" ++ Rest) ->
  110:                     ["5", _, _, "[" ++ _ | _] = string:lexemes(Rest, " "),
  111:                     true;
  112:                 (_) ->
  113:                     false
  114:             end,
  115:             Output
  116:         ),
  117:     %% spawn examples
  118:     SpawnFun =
  119:         fun () ->
  120:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  121:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  122:        end,
  123:     %% trace subset examples
  124:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_time}),
  125:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  126:     %% timer
  127:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  128:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  129:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time,
  130:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  131:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile2).
  132: 
  133: call_memory_ad_hoc() ->
  134:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_memory measurement"}].
  135: 
  136: call_memory_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  137:     ct:capture_start(),
  138:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_memory}),
  139:     ct:capture_stop(),
  140:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  141:     %% expect third line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3   5     32   6.40  [...]",
  142:     ?assertMatch(["lists:seq_loop/3", "5", "32", _, "[" ++ _ | _], string:lexemes(lists:nth(3, Output), " ")),
  143:     %% spawn examples
  144:     SpawnFun =
  145:         fun () ->
  146:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  147:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  148:        end,
  149:     %% trace subset examples
  150:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  151:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile1),
  152:     %% timer
  153:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  154:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  155:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  156:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile2).
  157: 
  158: lists_seq_loop(N) ->
  159:     [int_to_bin_twice(M) || M <- lists:seq(1, N)].
  160: 
  161: int_to_bin_twice(M) ->
  162:     B = integer_to_binary(M),
  163:     <<B/binary, B/binary>>.
  164: 
  165: %% Ensure total is not truncated,
  166: %% as per https://github.com/erlang/otp/issues/8139
  167: call_memory_total(_Config) ->
  168:     ct:capture_start(),
  169:     ok = tprof:profile(?MODULE, lists_seq_loop, [10000], #{type => call_memory}),
  170:     ct:capture_stop(),
  171:     ?assertNotMatch(nomatch, string:find(ct:capture_get(), " 150000 ")),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: sort() ->
  175:     [{doc, "Tests sorting methods work"}].
  176: 
  177: sort(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  178:     %% sort examples
  179:     ct:capture_start(),
  180:     ok = tprof:profile(
  181:         fun () ->
  182:             Group = lists:seq(100, 120),
  183:             rand:uniform(hd(Group))
  184:         end, #{report => {process, {measurement_per_call, descending}}, type => call_memory}),
  185:     ct:capture_stop(),
  186:     Out = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  187:     %% measurement per call is 5th column
  188:     Col = 5,
  189:     Column5 = [string:to_integer(lists:nth(Col, Lexemes)) || Ln <- Out,
  190:         length(Lexemes = string:lexemes(Ln, " ")) >= Col],
  191:     WPC = [Words || {Words, []} <- Column5],
  192:     %% ensure descending sort
  193:     ?assertEqual(lists:reverse(lists:sort(WPC)), WPC).
  194: 
  195: rootset() ->
  196:     [{doc, "Tests rootset of processes supplied to ad-hoc profiler"}].
  197: 
  198: rootset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  199:     TestCase = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  200:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(TestCase),
  201:     Fun = fun () -> ok = pg:join(TestCase, lists:seq(1, 2), self()) end,
  202:     %% rootset tests
  203:     {ok, Profile} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => [TestCase], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  204:     TwoProcs = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  205:     ?assertEqual(2, maps:size(TwoProcs)), %% must be pg and "profiled process"
  206:     %% now trace all processes, existing and new
  207:     {ok, ProfAll} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => processes, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  208:     %% at least tprof, pg2 and new profiled processes are traced
  209:     ?assert(map_size(tprof:inspect(ProfAll)) >= 3),
  210:     gen_server:stop(Scope).
  211: 
  212: set_on_spawn() ->
  213:     [{doc, "Tests tprof running with extra spawned processes"}].
  214: 
  215: set_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  216:     %% profile a function that spawns additional process
  217:     {done, Profile} = tprof:profile(
  218:         fun () ->
  219:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  220:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  221:         end, #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  222:     {done, ProfileMFA} = tprof:profile(?MODULE, seq, [32], #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  223:     %% check totals
  224:     #{all := {call_memory, _G1, TotalProfile}} = tprof:inspect(Profile, total, measurement),
  225:     #{all := {call_memory, _G2, TotalProfileMFA}} = tprof:inspect(ProfileMFA, total, measurement),
  226:     %% only 1 process must be there
  227:     ?assertEqual(1, maps:size(tprof:inspect(Profile)), {set_on_spawn, Profile}),
  228:     %% check per-process stats
  229:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  230:         8 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, 9, 9.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile));
  231:         4 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, 10, 10.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile))
  232:     end,
  233:     %% MFA takes 6 more words. This test should be improved to depend less on the internal
  234:     %%  implementation.
  235:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  236:         8 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, 13, 13.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA));
  237:         4 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, 14, 14.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA))
  238:     end.
  239: 
  240: seq(Max) ->
  241:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, Max) end),
  242:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end.
  243: 
  244: live_trace() ->
  245:     [{doc, "Tests memory tracing for pre-existing processes"}].
  246: 
  247: live_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  248:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  249:     Pid = spawn_link(
  250:         fun () ->
  251:             receive
  252:                 {From, C} ->
  253:                     [lists:seq(1, 2) || _ <- lists:seq(1, C)],
  254:                     From ! {self(), done}
  255:             end
  256:         end),
  257:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  258:     1 = tprof:enable_trace(Pid),
  259:     Pid ! {self(), 12},
  260:     receive {Pid, done} -> ok end,
  261:     catch tprof:disable_trace(Pid),
  262:     Profile = tprof:collect(),
  263:     ProcInspected = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  264:     %% white box check: list comprehension with 1-arity, and 100% allocation
  265:     %% tprof:format(user, ProcInspected),
  266:     #{Pid := {call_memory, 48, [{?MODULE, {_LC, 1}, 13, 48, _, 100.0}]}} = ProcInspected,
  267:     tprof:stop().
  268: 
  269: patterns() ->
  270:     [{doc, "Tests pattern enable/disable correctness"}].
  271: 
  272: patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  273:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  274:     %% test errors
  275:     ?assertEqual({error, {not_traced, pg, get_members, '_'}}, tprof:clear_pattern(pg, get_members, '_')),
  276:     ?assertEqual({error, {trace_pattern, ?MODULE, seq, 2}}, tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, seq, 2)),
  277:     %% successful patterns
  278:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, seq, 1),
  279:     3 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  280:     1 = tprof:clear_pattern(?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2),
  281:     Expected = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  282:     ?assertEqual(#{?MODULE => Expected}, tprof:get_trace_map()),
  283:     %% verify tracing flags
  284:     verify_trace([{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Expected], [{?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2}]),
  285:     %% trace the entire ?MODULE module, and then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  286:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  287:     3 = tprof:clear_pattern(?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  288:     1 = tprof:clear_pattern(?MODULE, seq, 1),
  289:     Cleared = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 2}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  290:     Traced = ?MODULE:module_info(functions) -- Cleared,
  291:     verify_trace([{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Cleared]),
  292:     %% clear all, which clears lists too
  293:     _ = tprof:clear_pattern('_', '_', '_'),
  294:     verify_trace([], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced ++ Cleared]),
  295:     ?assertEqual(#{}, tprof:get_trace_map()),
  296: 
  297:     %% Trace the entire node then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  298:     _ = tprof:set_pattern('_', '_', '_'),
  299:     ?assertEqual(all, tprof:get_trace_map()),
  300: 
  301:     tprof:stop().
  302: 
  303: verify_trace(On, Off) ->
  304:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, []}, erlang:trace_info(MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- On],
  305:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, false}, erlang:trace_info(MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- Off].
  306: 
  307: pattern_fun(Any) -> Any.
  308: pattern_fun(Any, Any2) -> {Any, Any2}.
  309: pattern_fun(Any, Any2, Any3) -> {Any, Any2, Any3}.
  310: 
  311: processes() ->
  312:     [{doc, "Tests that process management for enabling/disabling traces works"}].
  313: 
  314: processes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  315:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  316:     Pid2 = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  317:     register(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pid2),
  318:     %% test a mix of pids/registered processes/single PID calls
  319:     ?assertEqual(2, tprof:enable_trace([Pid, Pid2])),
  320:     ?assertEqual(0, tprof:disable_trace('$sure_not_exist')),
  321:     ?assertEqual({1, ['$sure_not_exist']}, tprof:enable_trace([Pid, '$sure_not_exist'])),
  322:     ok = gen:stop(Pid),
  323:     ok = gen:stop(Pid2).
  324: 
  325: server() ->
  326:     [{doc, "Tests for gen_server-based API"}].
  327: 
  328: server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     %% start an extra pg scope - we'll trace it during profiling
  330:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  331:     %% simulate existing process
  332:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  333:     %% start the profiler
  334:     {ok, Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  335:     %% test ad-hoc profile clash
  336:     ?assertException(error, {already_started, Srv}, tprof:profile(fun spawn_loop/0)),
  337:     %% test live trace
  338:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, dispatch, '_'),
  339:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(pg, '_', '_'),
  340:     %% watch for pg traces and for our process
  341:     2 = tprof:enable_trace([Pid, ?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  342:     %% run the traced operation
  343:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, Pid]}),
  344:     %% collect profile (can save it to a file for later analysis)
  345:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  346:     %% must not be empty, and must contain 3-words dispatch from this module,
  347:     %%  and at least something from pg in two processes
  348:     ?assertNotEqual([], FirstProfile),
  349:     ?assertEqual({?MODULE, dispatch, 2, [{Pid, 1, 3}]}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, FirstProfile)),
  350:     ?assertMatch({pg, handle_call, 3, [{Scope, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, FirstProfile)),
  351:     ?assertMatch({pg, join, 3, [{Pid, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(join, 2, FirstProfile)),
  352:     %% pause tracing
  353:     ok = tprof:pause(),
  354:     %% ensure paused by running more code but keeping the trace
  355:     %% ensure collection still returns the previous result
  356:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, Pid]}),
  357:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  358:     %% continue, ensure new results are collected
  359:     ok = tprof:continue(),
  360:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, leave, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, [Pid, Pid]]}),
  361:     ?assertNotEqual({call_memory, FirstProfile}, tprof:collect()),
  362:     %% restart all counters from zero and ensure that we again collect the original data
  363:     ok = tprof:restart(),
  364:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, Pid]}),
  365:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  366: 
  367:     %% test ad-hoc profiling can be done while running server-aided
  368:     %% for that, profiler should have very specific pattern
  369:     {_, AdHoc} = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 32], #{registered => false, pattern => {lists, '_', '_'},
  370:         report => return, type => call_memory}),
  371:     %% check totals: must be 64 words allocated by a single lists:seq_loop
  372:     ?assertMatch(#{all := {call_memory, 64, [{lists, _, _, 64, _, _}]}},
  373:                  tprof:inspect(AdHoc, total, measurement)),
  374:     %% verify that server-aided version still works
  375:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  376:     ok = tprof:stop(),
  377:     ok = gen_server:stop(Scope),
  378:     ok = gen:stop(Pid).
  379: 
  380: %% nano-gen-server purely for tracing
  381: spawn_loop() ->
  382:     receive
  383:         {'$gen_call', From, Call} ->
  384:             dispatch(Call, From),
  385:             spawn_loop();
  386:         {system, From, {terminate,normal}} ->
  387:             gen:reply(From, ok)
  388:     end.
  389: 
  390: dispatch({spawn_link, Fun}, From) ->
  391:     gen:reply(From, erlang:spawn_link(Fun));
  392: dispatch({apply, M, F, A}, From) ->
  393:     gen:reply(From, erlang:apply(M, F, A)).
  394: 
  395: hierarchy() ->
  396:     [{doc, "Tests tracing for process hierarchy"}].
  397: 
  398: hierarchy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  399:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  400:     Traced = tprof:enable_trace({all_children, kernel_sup}),
  401:     ?assert(Traced > 5),
  402:     ?assert(tprof:set_pattern(code_server, '_', '_') > 5),
  403:     _ = code:get_path(), %% makes a call to code_server
  404:     %% disabling all processes tracing should return more than "children of"
  405:     ?assert(tprof:disable_trace(processes) > Traced),
  406:     {call_memory, Profile} = tprof:collect(),
  407:     tprof:stop(),
  408:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, Profile)).
  409: 
  410: code_reload() ->
  411:     [{doc, "Tests that collection does not fail for a hot-code-reloaded module"}].
  412: 
  413: code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  414:     {_, Sample}  = tprof:profile(fun () -> code:load_file(?MODULE) end,
  415:                                  #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  416:     %% don't care about actual returned values, but do care that profile/2 does not crash
  417:     ?assertNotEqual([], Sample).
  418: 
  419: code_load() ->
  420:     [{doc, "Tests profiling works for modules loaded during profiling"}].
  421: 
  422: code_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  423:     code:purge(sofs),
  424:     code:delete(sofs),
  425:     {_, Sample} =
  426:         tprof:profile(fun () -> sofs:relation([{b,1},{c,2},{c,3}]) end,
  427:                       #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  428:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(sofs, 1, Sample)).
